events.description: Bring your instruments, set the stage on fire and make the crowd go crazy with some mind-blowing perfor- mances and show us who owns the stage in this battle!.
events.rules:
1. The band size is supposed to be 8 members at maximum.
2. Limit performance time to 18 minutes(including setup).
3. Eastern and western performances are allowed.
4. SAM ID / online registration is a must.
5. Video to be submitted for shortlisting (5 mins max, send it to musicclub.iiitdm@gmail.com). 6. Participant can perform only for one band. Extra points for original compositions!
7. Only a drum kit and keyboard stand will be provided.
8. Decision of the judges is final and binding. Any act of misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.
events.prize:
First Place- prizes worth 20K 
 Second Place - prizes worth 15K

events.description: You’re insecure, don’t know what for! Come sing with us and rock the floor. Calling all the hummers, profes- sionals and wannabes to sing your heart out, be it kara- oke or not.
events.rules:
1. Any genre of music is allowed.
2. SAM ID / online registration is a must: on-spot registration at the last moment will not be allowed
3. Video to be submitted for shortlisting (4 mins max,send it to musicclub.iiitdm@gmail.com) 4. One submission per participant.
5. Final performance should be under 5 minutes.
6. Participant may use a karaoke or any accompanying instrument (played by him/her or another one person) though only vocals will be judged.
7. Decision of the judges is final and binding. Any act of misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.
events.prize:
First Place- Prizes worth 6K
Second Place- Prizes worth 3K

events.description: Have a thing for recreating comic scripts? Let the wild- est of your imagination flow and deliver an interesting comic script in your own style.
events.rules:
1.  Duration: 2 hrs.
2.  Individual Event.
3.  A short note describing the art piece must be provided.
4.  Usage of the Internet and mobile phones are strictly prohibited unless told.
5.  Time limits must be strictly adhered to.
6.  The decision of the judges will be final.
6. Rubric- Creativity, Cohesivity, Detailing, Neatness

events.description: You think you have it in you to create an outfit ready to hit the runway? This is your chance.Unleash the inner fashionista in you by making your “dream” costume.
events.rules:
1.  Teams with a max size of 2 can participate.
2.  Only the materials provided must be used.
3.  A short note describing the costume must be written.
4.  Usage of the Internet and mobile phones are strictly prohibited unless told.\5.  Time limits must be strictly adhered to.
6.  The decision of the judges will be final.
7.  Rubric - Creativity,Presentation,Integrality,Detailing,Comfortableness

events.description: We are bringing the famous Masterchef’s “Mystery Box Challenge” to our college, only this time with art supplies
events.rules:
1.  Teams with a max size of 2 can participate.
2.  Must use all the materials picked out.
3.  Only the materials provided must be used.
4.  A short note describing the art piece must be written.
5.  Usage of the Internet and mobile phones are strictly prohibited unless told.
6. Time limits must be strictly adhered to.
7.  The decision of the judges will be final.
7.  Rubric - Creativity, Presentation, Detailing

events.description: Dance is the language of the body. Show your passion on the dance stage and let your body do the talking.
events.rules:
1. One member.
2.  Time limit - 3 - 5 min
 3.  Two rounds.
4.  The first round will be a song prepared by the participant beforehand .
5. The second round will be using props.
6.  Judging criteria:  Technique ,Variety,Creativity ,Stage presence and Expressions .
events.prize:
First Place- Prizes worth 3.5K
2nd prize-2K
3rd prize - 1K

events.description: Draw your weapons, sharpen your bodies, forge your forces and get ready for war because, you know, *Winter is coming*.
events.rules:
1.  One round
2.  Team size - 10 - 25
3.  Time limit - 10 - 12 min
4.  Judging Criteria: Technique - Variety,Teamwork , Originality, Use of Props ,Impact and Presentation .
events.prize:
First Place- Prizes worth 20K
2nd prize-15K
3rd prize -8.5K

events.description: A video recorder, a good beat and some crazy moves is what it takes to prove yourself to the world. Have you got what it takes? Prove it.
events.rules:
1 member 
1 round
Time limit - Maximum 1 min
Judging criteria : public favorite

events.description: Flaunt your photoshop skills and make your photos articulate what you wish to convey.
events.rules:
1.  Number of participants:1. Submissions per participant:1
2.  Organizing committee has complete right to change schedule of the event,cancellation of the event and take any necessary actions in violation of rules.
3.  The copyrights of the submissions made will be entitled to us and will be used for promotions.
4.  The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.

events.description: Let the film roll out of the canister to capture the actor in you and weave it into an amazing short film.
events.rules:
1.  Time limit maximum 8 minutes.
2.  Mobile and professional cameras are allowed (video quality must be in 1080p)
3.  Script the film adherence to theme DREAMS.
4.  No restrictions in language of the film, subtitles are mandatory.
5.  Film must be submitted before the deadline given.
6.  Videos that portray or otherwise include inappropriate and/or offensive content, including provocative nudity, violence, human rights and/or environmental violation, and/or any other contents deemed to be contrary to the law, religious, cultural and moral traditions and practices of India, are strictly prohibited and will be immediately discarded.
7.  Organizing committee has complete right to change schedule of the event,cancellation of the event and take any necessary actions in violation of rules.
8.  The copyrights of the submissions made will be entitled to us and will be used for promotions.
9.  The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.

events.description: Climate change is an alarming hazard. So make the mankind feel the guilt of befouling the environment through your hard-hitting photos.
events.rules:
1.  Number of participants:1. Submissions per participant:1
2.  Photos submitted must be at least 640pixels on the shorter side, and no more than 2000pixels on the longer side. Images should be no longer than 2MB. Photos must be in JPEG format.
3.  All submitted photos must contain the original EXIF metadata information. However there must be no border(s), logos, copyright marks, identifying marks or any other visible references and/or marks on the image.
4.  Photos that portray or otherwise include appropriate and/or offensive content, including provocative nudity, violence, human rights and/or environmental violation, and/or any other contents deemed to be contrary to the law, religious, cultural and moral traditions and practices of India, are strictly prohibited and will be immediately discarded.
5.  Organizing committee has complete right to change schedule of the event,cancellation of the event and take any necessary actions in violation of rules.
6.  The copyrights of the submissions made will be entitled to us and will be used for promotions.
7.  The decision of the judges shall be final and binding.

events.description: Put your thinking caps on and brace up for a flaming quiz on kollywood.
events.rules:
1.  Quiz competition based on Kollywood 
2.  Max 3 members per team
3.  On Spot Registration
events.prize:
First Place - Prizes worth 3K
Seconf Place - Prizes worth 2K

events.description: Add fuel to the event with your arguments, a cutthroat debate where ingenious play with words would fetch a victory.
events.rules:
Group of Max 3 and Min 2 
2.  Slots and topics will be written in chits and picked by two teams as a group 
3.  Round 1: Each team will be given 2 mins to put forward their thoughts 
4.  Round 2: Each team will be given two mins to oppose the other team 
5.  Round 3: Conclusion for 1 min  
6.  On spot registration
events.prize:
First Place- Prizes worth 1K
Second Place- Prizes worth 0.5K

events.description: Bring out the Kalki in you and deliver the most interest- ing story of all and win big.
events.rules:
1.  Story writing competition (Individual)
2.  Duration of 1 hour
3. Topic will be given on spot
4.  Must be written in Tamil 
5 . On spot registration 
6.  Topic will be given on spot
events.prize:
First Place- Prizes worth 1.5K
Second Place- Prizes worth 1K

events.description: As we have entered a new decade, let us take a look at all the facts and achievements that India and her people have conquered over the 70 years of her free- dom and over centuries of her history.
events.rules:
1.  The maximum team size is permitted to 3
2.  All members should have the samgatha passport failure to which will lead to immediate disqualification.
3. Quiz Masters decision is FINAL.
events.prize:
First Place - Prizes worth 2.5K
Second Place - Prizes worth 1.5K
Third Place - Prizes worth 1K

events.description: Seen all the Marvel movies till date? Able to quote Chandler by heart? Watched so much anime you can understand Japanese? Well, this quiz is for you! Test your trivia over various fandoms and earn something more than just money!
events.rules:
1.  The maximum team size is permitted to 3.
2.  All members of the team must have a samgatha passport, failure to which will lead to immediate disqualification.
3.  Quiz Masters decision is FINAL
events.prize:
First Place - Prizes worth 2.5K
Second Place - Prizes worth 1.5K
Third Place - Prizes worth 1K

events.description: Think you know the latest trends on Instagram? Can you tell the difference between the floss and the nae nae? Put the hours of mindlessly scrolling through your phone to use and try your luck at the meme quiz!
events.rules:
1.  The maximum team size is permitted to 2.
2.  All members of the team must have a samgatha passport, failure to which will lead to immediate disqualification.
3. Quiz Masters decision is FINAL.
events.prize:
First Place - Prizes worth 2.5K
Second Place - Prizes worth 1.5 K

events.description: It's time to glint in the spotlight! All you have to do is stir the emotions of audience with your expressions. So, make up your crew and stun the mob with an awe- struck performance.
events.rules:
1.  Theme of play - No restriction on the themes.
	 Type of drama includes mime, Dance drama, skit, variety show, etc.
2.  Team Size Minimum of 3 to maximum of 15.
3.  Language The drama can be in - English, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu.
4.  Time Limit - The team should perform for a minimum of 10 minutes to a maximum of 30 minutes.
events.prize:
First Place - Prizes worth 15K
Second Place - Prizes worth 10 K
Third Place - Prizes worth 7.5K

events.description: You need not be a chef to cook up stories, just season your creativity with some spontaneity and you are an improv king.
events.rules:
1. Team Size - Maximum of 4 members per team
2.  Language - The act can be in any of the following languages English, Hindi, Tamil and Telugu.
3. The performed scene should last between 2-5 mins
4. Limited props will be provided.
events.prize:
First Place - Prizes worth 4K
Second Place - Prizes worth 2 K
Third Place - Prizes worth 1K

events.description: A well-written script creates in the mind of the reader the experience of watching a movie. To that end, you must describe images, sounds, actions, and speech in such a way that the scenes unspool as they would on a screen.
events.rules:
1.  Script can be in the English, Tamil, Hindi, Telugu.
2.  If the script is written by a writing team, it must be submitted by one of the writers with the consent of the other (any and all prizes will be sent to the writer who submitted the winning script, it is the responsibility of the writing team to share or divide the prizes.)
3.  There is no limit to the number of different scripts you may submit. Duplicate entries of the same project, however, will be automatically disqualified.
4.  Once a script has been submitted, no substitutions will be accepted. No corrected pages or revised drafts allowed.
5.  Scripts must be the original work of the author(s)
events.prize:
First Place - Prizes worth 3K
Second Place - Prizes worth 2 K
Third Place - Prizes worth 1K

events.description: A collaborative online event between writers and artists where you interpret the art/story from that of other contestants. Creativity to its core!
events.rules:
1.  Takesplaceoveraspanof1week(Includingregistration) ○ Monday-Wednesday​:registrationperiodforboth
writers and artists
○ Wednesday23:59​:promptsaresenttowritersonly,
given up till Friday afternoon to submit a work of min
500 words
○ FridayafternoontoFriday23:59​:Artistsshouldchoose
pieces to work on.
○ Saturday00:00​:Artistsgettheirallottedpiecesandcan
create any art piece in relation with the written piece till
Sunday 23:59
● Registrationwindowwillbeopenfor12hours.Afterwhich
writers will be given a set of prompts to pick and choose from.
● Writerswillbeallowedtochooseoneormanyprompts,how
many ever required to write their story.
 
● Thestoryshouldhaveaminimumof500wordsandshould be submitted within 24 hours of the registration deadline. This is to ensure the artists will have a written piece to work on.
● WrittenworksshouldbesubmittedviaGoogledocs(toavoid artists unable to figure out handwriting thus making it difficult for them to draw)
● Artistswillthenbegivena6hourwindowtoselecttheworks they feel inspired by, and to ensure that no two artists pick the same work, they will provide a top 5 list and will be given a story in their top 5.
● Artistswillthenbegivena24hourwindowtocomeupwith an art piece depicting the written work they have chosen, interpreting the text and scenes as they see fit.
● FailuretosubmittheworkontimeorprovideSAMIDatthe time of submission will lead to immediate disqualification.

events.description: Many dreams and ideas have existed in our rich history of human civilization. But, could those ideologies still be applicable today? Could you convince us of such a dream? Come and test your eloquence and glib of tongue and present us with ways on how to learn from the past to change the future.
events.rules:
1.  Participant will be given a prompt that is based on past myths and fairy tales projected onto today’s context
2.  He/She shall be given 5 minutes of prep time
3.  He/She will then be given 10 minutes to speak and act out the given topic
4.  He/She will be judged on Creativity,Spontaneity,Structure and Complexity.

events.description: In a time where ideas are in constant clash and flux of each other, it’s time to play the part of the judge and the jury in determining their usefulness. The goal? To convince the judges and the audience (jury) on who is right.
events.rules:
1.  Thiseventwillcontainthreerounds
2.  The first and last round will contain one on one debate while the second round will be a group discussion
3.  Each round will be a knockout
4.  Participants get 5 mins to prepare after prompt is given
5.  Time Structure for each round will be told during event
6. Prompts will be based on juxtaposing past political ideologies onto today’s context.
7.  Audience interruptions (upto 2 each)for P.o.Is are allowed.
